About cookies
This control panel describes what kinds of cookies are present on this website and allows you to enable or disable different types of cookies.
Cookies are small pieces of text saved by websites to your computer. Cookies are how your computer remembers things you’ve already done on the internet and are an important part of making modern websites work properly.
Because cookies may contain information about your browsing habits, some people prefer to turn them off entirely. However, turning off cookies can prevent websites from working the way you expect.
Essential cookies
These cookies are critical to the functioning of this website and cannot be disabled through this control panel. They don’t contain any information about your identity. They can be disabled through your browser, but doing so could cause some parts of this website to stop working.
WordPress
wordpress_, wp-
Always enabled
Analytics cookies
These cookies collect information on visitors to our website to help us understand how well our website is working and how to improve it.
No vendors are present in this group.
Targeting cookies
These cookies collect information on your browsing habits to help our advertising partners show you more relevant ads.
No vendors are present in this group.
Social media cookies
These cookies help social media sites understand your likes and dislikes so they can show you more relevant content. They also make it easier to share contents from other websites such as ours to your social media profiles.
No vendors are present in this group.

Submit An Event
-------
-------
Thank you for submitting your event the the VisitGainesville.com event calendar. Complete the form below to add details, including a short description and photo. Showcase your event to a wider audience, completely free of charge.
Please note:
If your “venue” or “organizer” does not appear in the drop-down menu, complete your entry without the venue, then email
info@visitgainesville.com
with your venue details. A member of the website content team will be happy to update the venue information. Once your venue has been entered into the system, it will remain available for future calendar entries.
Did you know that visitors plan months in advance?
Add details for upcoming dates and future events later in the year.  Tens of thousands of visitors and locals turn to VisitGainesville.com and to the What’s Good® guide of weekly events to plan visits and weekends filled with activities and entertainment in Alachua County.
Click to view event submission guidelines (pdf)

Terms of Submission
By submitting event information to Visit Gainesville, Alachua County, I attest that:

- I am the event owner or designated responsible party and have the authority to submit the event and release and authorize the County to display and reproduce the given image, photo, logo, or other work including but not limited to, websites, social media, the What’s Good guide of events.

- The event is open to the public and does not discriminate based on race; color; national origin; religion; sex; marital status; age; disability; sexual orientation; gender identify or expression.

- In accordance with applicable law, events whose purpose is to promote the religion of the provider, be significantly sectarian in nature, involve religious indoctrination, require participation in religious ritual, or encourage the preference of a religion are not to be submitted.

- The event is not political events or related to political activities.

- The event is fully accessible and complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).

Upon receipt by the County, submittals, including email addresses of organizers and all related content, become public records subject to the provisions Chapter 119 F.S., Florida Public Records Law.
Before publication, event submissions are reviewed for accuracy and editorial guidelines.

About cookies
This control panel describes what kinds of cookies are present on this website and allows you to enable or disable different types of cookies.
Cookies are small pieces of text saved by websites to your computer. Cookies are how your computer remembers things you’ve already done on the internet and are an important part of making modern websites work properly.
Because cookies may contain information about your browsing habits, some people prefer to turn them off entirely. However, turning off cookies can prevent websites from working the way you expect.
Essential cookies
These cookies are critical to the functioning of this website and cannot be disabled through this control panel. They don’t contain any information about your identity. They can be disabled through your browser, but doing so could cause some parts of this website to stop working.

Analytics cookies
These cookies collect information on visitors to our website to help us understand how well our website is working and how to improve it.
No vendors are present in this group.
Targeting cookies
These cookies collect information on your browsing habits to help our advertising partners show you more relevant ads.
No vendors are present in this group.
Social media cookies
These cookies help social media sites understand your likes and dislikes so they can show you more relevant content. They also make it easier to share contents from other websites such as ours to your social media profiles.

About Us
-------
-------
Visit Gainesville, Alachua County, FL is the Visitors and Convention Bureau, the tourism sales and marketing arm, for Alachua County.
We’re ready to assist you in planning your vacation or your meeting. From your initial inquiry to dining and entertainment recommendations to the ride home, our experienced and professional staff is your guide to the community.
Vision Statement
Located in North Central Florida, Gainesville and Alachua County is a unique family-friendly, university community, well known for its exciting blend of cultural, historic and natural attractions as well as fine arts and sporting events. Home of the University of Florida “Gators”, the area draws business and convention travelers from throughout the world to state-of-the-art research, medical and conference facilities. Careful preservation and use of natural and manmade resources help preserve for the leisure visitors the County’s unique eco-systems and cultural assets. Tourism is an important contributor to economic development in Alachua County and is woven into the fabric of the community in a way that enhances the residents’ quality of life and the visitor experience.

About Us
-------
-------
About Us
-------
-------
Visit Gainesville, Alachua County, FL is the Visitors and Convention Bureau, the tourism sales and marketing arm, for Alachua County.
We’re ready to assist you in planning your vacation or your meeting. From your initial inquiry to dining and entertainment recommendations to the ride home, our experienced and professional staff is your guide to the community.
Vision Statement
Located in North Central Florida, Gainesville and Alachua County is a unique family-friendly, university community, well known for its exciting blend of cultural, historic and natural attractions as well as fine arts and sporting events. Home of the University of Florida “Gators”, the area draws business and convention travelers from throughout the world to state-of-the-art research, medical and conference facilities. Careful preservation and use of natural and manmade resources help preserve for the leisure visitors the County’s unique eco-systems and cultural assets. Tourism is an important contributor to economic development in Alachua County and is woven into the fabric of the community in a way that enhances the residents’ quality of life and the visitor experience.

Getting Here
Centrally located in northern Florida, Gainesville is easily accessible from any direction and from many major metropolitan areas.
By Plane
You can fly directly into
Gainesville Regional Airport
(GNV). It’s just minutes from Downtown, with daily flight service from Delta and American Airlines.
By Train
If you prefer to ride the rails, Amtrak’s Thruway Bus service connects with stops in Lakeland and Jacksonville.
By Car
By car, getting here is usually a pretty straight shot.
I-75 runs nearby making trips north from southern Florida easy, and doing the same for folks coming down from Georgia.
From Orlando
, take Florida’s Turnpike to I-75 North
From Jacksonville
, west on I-10 then south on Highway 301 to Highway 24 will get you here faster you think, plus you’ll run through some small, friendly towns
From Tampa
, take I-75 North
From Miami
, take Florida’s Turnpike to I-75 North
From Tallahassee
, take I-10 East to I-75 South
From Atlanta,
take I-75 South
By bus
Gainesville is a destination for Greyhound, Megabus, and RedCoach bus services.

Events
-------
-------
Make Plans for Fun, Adventure & Enrichment
Alachua County, Florida is a destination rich in culture and nature  with a county seat in Gainesville and including the historic and thriving communities of Alachua, Archer, Hawthorne, High Springs, La Crosse, Micanopy, Newberry, and Waldo.
Located along the 1-75 corridor, Alachua County offers world-class museums, captivating live music, and over 100 miles of trails throughout eight state parks. Enjoy outdoor activities like hiking, biking, birding, or swimming in the area’s crystal-blue freshwater springs. Explore craft breweries, museums, a butterfly rainforest, serene botanical gardens, and so much more. Whether you’re drawn to outdoor adventures, cultural escapades, or simply seeking a place to call home, this eclectic county promises something you’ll love.
